LQoTXEfEahUmVbo5Ev7SMA.text: A super place in Kensington to grab a bite if you are hungry, or to spend some more time relaxing with a drink in hand. I had breakfast here and found the spot to be an efficient and well-run establishment. My grapefruit juice also went down a treat. The menu is varied, the food cooked exactly as you like it without needing to send it back to the kitchen three or four times. I was here on a Sunday morning which was full of hustle and bustle but that was charming rather than annoying and I have a feeling that for a late lunch or dinner, the pace would be slower and the hustle and bustle minimised. A huge plus in my book - the tables here actually have space between them! Something not found often in this lovely city!

hkR_i06yltvYbodI5B4plw.text: Nice place for a good dinner, Friendly staff. It's a bit loud. It's nice to be able to get breakfast any time. They have some fun cocktails worth trying.I did have a dish chip on my meal and they comped me without asking, so that's nice. I recommend it.

VjqmD_UQZjCcS7HOEsWr7g.text: The "Full English" was quite delicious.  Everything on the plate was good. The Balan potatoes, bacon, and sausage were my favorite. The brown toast was amazing. Reasonably priced however, 3.05 for 300ml of soda is a bit steep.

CgspC9pqumpLXRLXeS5E_w.text: We stopped in at Balans every morning for breakfast while we were in London.  The service was top notch, staff was very nice and sociable.  The food was excellent and very reasonable priced for the region.  We popped our head into a few other places to try to get a variety, but nothing ever quite matched up to the quality and service we received here.  Thanks for the great service, food, and conversation!

bFSDu647w2snHjRLNMt0Nw.text: Good solid brunch place with portions are big enough to share. The restaurant's layout makes the place feel cramped.The mirrors are angled a little funny and the whole restaurant feels a little crowded and claustrophobic.My favorites are the blueberry pancakes and the breakfast burrito!

Dl8Q-F5S00s54CzJrAJd_A.text: I was looking for some brunch and found this restaurant. The english breakfast certainly did not disappoint - it's one of the best I've had. The menu is quite varied, which pleasantly surprised me. However, the nicest part of this restaurant is probably the lighting, which gives it a spacious, relaxed feel.

htz9BuuXkHC-IL2JORThhg.text: Had a lovely breakfast - or I should say brunch. VERY affordable, a lot of bang for the buck. I had the jumbo breakfast, wich included eggs, bacon, sausage, fried potatoes, toast, and a huge american pancake served with fresh fruits and berries. And a glass of fresh juice. Only 9,95 gbp. And the service was very good too. They did everything right; asked how I wanted the eggs, and what kind of bread i wanted and so on. Free wi-fi.

rPP11dhwCgV5VfqLH8TSGA.text: My friend took me to this restaurant and I absolutely loved it! On recommendation of the fun and engaging waiter we each ordered the cocktail 'Porn Star' which came with a nice shot of champagne. The drink was just divine, so much that we ended up ordering a second round. We also ate a quesadilla that was delicious. It was a very pleasant experience and I'll definitely go back to have a proper meal and one of their cocktails.

qf05u-qQ8QQhJ06er-_SWQ.text: For Yanks visiting for the Olympics, my fave neighborhood casual breakfast spot will cure your homesickness. Food is more your style and the staff is both friendly and professional. Pancakes are good though not often on my diet and the burrito is enormous. Can be a serious wait on occasion.

UkzoSH9Kcbfp0tJ_6IaRSw.text: Just like the other yelpers, I am so excited to find an American style breakfast place. Came here two days in a row but only ate once. I had the breakfast burrito and it was great (but I must admit the copious amount of red chilies was too much for me) and I sampled a friends fries and they were fantastic. A friend had the fruit plate and it was sizeable...rather than some other breakfast places in London where I notice you pay 5£ for a little bowl of what I call the undesirable fruit salad fruits - oranges grapes and grapefruits. The restaurant is spacious and has a skylight so if you're in the back it's still light. There are two big booths that can fit round eight people so it's good for groups. I live in the general area and can't wait to go back to try a Burger or a BBQ chicken sandwich...and I have a feeling it'll be as soon as next weekend.

XrlVLvi6TXNgL3AOu-bpAA.text: I really like English food - I really do.  But I don't love traditional English breakfast.  So I was very happy to find this little place down the street from my hotel.   It has more of a cafe feel, with great service and free wifi.  I had the breakfast burrito - fluffy eggs and tons of veggies with just the right amount of spice - and it was the perfect thing before I set out to be a tragic tourist.  Definitely a place I would visit again.

ikM5O9fJsFPDU9vH77piVA.text: Popped in here for breakfast before a conference that was happening round the corner.Firstly, the staff are all super-friendly, which is exactly what you need on a damp wednesday morning.I'm currently on a mission to find exceptional eggs benedict in London after 3 weeks of glorious breakfasts on holiday in California earlier in April. Balans have six types, and I opted for the bacon double with a blueberry pancake on the side.The benedict was passable. Probably a 7/10, which is really good for the UK. The hollandaise was slightly too goopy, but the quality of the bacon was top notch. They didn't serve it on a muffin, it was more of a ciabatta-esque slice. The eggs were perfectly poached and really good quality.The blueberry pancake was PERFECT. If I ever frequent balans again (I'm rarely in west London), I'll definitely go for a short stack.Great service, good coffee, lovely menu. Recommended. Go here over Giraffe unless you're wielding a couple of kids in buggies.

dbVudXlsPvIXPyajimuBmw.text: Pancakes are one of my absolute favourite things in the world, and Balan's American pancakes are deliciously fluffy, perfect served up with bacon and a drizzle (no, actually, a hefty gushing please!) of maple syrup! And any place that serves brunch until 5pm is a winner in my books. Other options that we were salivating over included a tantalizingly spicy breakfast burrito, a massive plate of steak, eggs and potatoes (a very small kid was tucking into this with huge enthusiasm at the next table), eggs benedict (salmon option sounds good) and corned beef hash with eggs. Wow, writing about all these is making me feel like 5pm is indeed a great time for breakfast! Definitely going to be making some return visits here! Friendly, attentive staff and reasonably priced for the area (about £10 for breakfast and coffee) - well unless you take a champagne cocktail with breakfast :-)

riFdjLsBQxjbEHQlohA2Vg.text: There's something deliciously incongruous about having breaky somewhere so clubby.   I'm here all bright eyed and bushy tailed tucking into my delicious pancakes (with pecan chip maple butter) and there's a full bar and chill out music...  It's like being on a clubbing holiday in 2002 - not just popping up to the high street for breakfast on a Sunday with the papers.  The mirrors raised at that angle over the tables can be a rude awakening, but you just need to position yourself on a bench underneath and once your coffee comes you'll be more ready to face the day.  The eggs are well scrambled, there are real cubed and fried potatoes and the veggie fry up option is by no means soggy or disappointing.  I often think about whether or not you'd come here in the evening and then come back in the morning - this one isn't open 24 hours like Soho...  The main menu is basic but easily passable, the specials are usually worth trying, and the deserts I can recommend quite highly, seems I have a thing for their desert chef, what with my pancake penchant, or else they put something addictive in the sugar...  And the cocktails are tasty if pricey - and they'll serve you one at breakfast if you can face it.  An Amaretto Sours goes surprisingly well with Maple Pecan Pancakes, it's like strudel.The main downside on the weekend AMs it the tres pushy owner.  He's a nice guy and all once you're sitting down, but he does try and poach you in off the street - but don't let him put you off, allow him draw you in with his tractor beam of insistent desperation that's totally unnecessary considering how good the wares on display are.  In fact to the manager I say - "Get people sitting in the window and give them nice big portions and watch the passers by clock it and hear their tummies rumble as they walk into the traffic light post...  In fact I'll give you a break here - I'll do it for you every week for free.  I don't mind, really, I can be quite selfless when it comes to supporting local businesses...  But I'll need to have the full veggie English AND a serving of fruit pancakes to really get their attention, right?"

umpGty41gCI8Q69zPzPBPw.text: Nice cafe that serves a lot of tasty staff. Their drinks are nice as well. My favoutites there are the desserts and especially the sorbets  if haven't tried them that's what I suggest.

sOrGem8MqgrKdBWA-RxX-Q.text: very good americanized breakfast that really hit the spot after 10 days in ireland/ england  reasonable pricing for london   very nice service

ZUD6cL0Tmq-_SKo4xBkz-g.text: I always go to Balans for breakfast. Great service and a nice place for being with friends or work. Lunch and evening meals are good but for me it is those early/mid morning visits that stand out.

4I4VQRXykeEIcc6p-hM_Jw.text: We found the perfect combination of quality, quantity, atmosphere and price.  Ten stars on a perfect breakfast.

PNoqMNIbehKkhzKLWWB4ow.text: Call me a glutton for punishment, but I keep seeking out the perfect brunch in London, a city which, in general, is pretty rubbish at brunch.  American classics like pancakes, waffles and french toast are hard to come by, and when found, tend to be a disappointment.  Free refills on coffee, a necessity on a Sunday morning, are nowhere to be found.  Balans offers an acceptable attempt at brunch, and will do in a pinch in the future. The omelettes are pretty good, the eggs benedict looked an absolute treat, and the pancakes were passable, but not as fluffy or melt-in-your-mouth delicious as a run of the mill pancake house in Nowhere, America.  But the free refills on your coffee?  Ha, keep looking elsewhere.

ojbzIme97zrzDOuWBmjShw.text: A cheerful place where you are always welcome to have a cocktail or grab a bite. My friend introduced me to it several months ago, and I quite liked it. If only the waiters were not that flirty!

lAa2OGeRr6QEUiK20Qkesg.text: Balans is great because it has such an ecclectic mix of food, from all different areas of Europe. It is quite pricey, but you know you're paying for great food and great service. I find the tvs playing music channels a bit annoying and distracting put it cannot put me off the lovely food!

sKaKSuhhvvXOkpiJlPKHxQ.text: Ok for food, but really like the setting and service. Came here for the last few weekends, usually with friends or even alone with my iPad. Good place to start a relaxing Sunday. But if you are craving some good breakfast, maybe the full English or the jumbo set. Good deal in a typical London street corner.

photos.caption: Photo of Balans Soho Society - London, United Kingdom. Cosy setting
Photo of Balans Soho Society - London, United Kingdom. Soy latte

uL8jaJJDOL7zc3fdCMdBqw.text: Great food and service!! The traditional English breakfast was fantastic, big enough to share, fresh and delicious!!

OyKvNvvifXRkBgSQU2XL4Q.text: Being a girl who is a 'Happy Punter' - come what may - I felt that status entitled me to go to a Gay Friendly eatery in Kensington with a Gay & Jolly Journalistic Colleague who swore that if I didn't like the brunch at this rather smart establishment, he would actually pay for it.Known in my Press Office as 'Miserable Mel' (a most delightful fellow whose only character flaw is his 'Scrooge like' attitude to life) the devil in me took up the challenge. Knowing that I could, as a last resort, say I didn't like something. Then again, that really isn't me. Lying through my 'mouth - full of food - teeth,' I try to leave that to some of the Political figures I have cornered in flagrante delicto.Surprise, surprise. Usually I have found that most chains of restaurants vary from area to area. Not here. Not at this branch. The 'Eggs Benedict' which I devoured had the spiritual charm to it that Mrs LeGrand Benedict of Delmonico's Restaurant in the USA no doubt bestowed upon her original creation over 150 years ago. It was scrumptious and hit the spot!Not only that, the staff smiled constantly, never forgot us for a moment, as they often do in chains - all predicated upon if they recruit their people from Spain, Portugal or merely that salubrious seaside location, Clacton-on-Sea.We were served, ate, felt delightfully looked after and refuelled and were out of there in three shakes of a Lamb's Tail - and back in the office before the Editor even knew we were absent. How many Journo's can say that line quickly - three times.Of course I paid. Happily I might add.

wPGCzdsu3bvO5m45UVkUzg.text: Best place that is a chain business for brunch. All day breakfast on offer, and the full English went down well for me and my friend. A nice simple menu with a decent selection of alcohol and fresh fruit juices. Comfortable seating and relaxing atmosphere created by the staff not giving you pressure to leave. Brunch lasted almost two hours...enjoy.

ujk3oGIrv8yLyJpnZaLYPw.text: My boyfriend and I came here for brunch and we enjoyed this restaurant very much.  My boyfriend got the Traditional English Breakfast but I wanted to try something new and ordered the liver platter.  Since I've never had this dish before, I asked a lot of questions to the waitress and she was extremely friendly and helpful and did a great job at explaining what my dish would look like and how it should be cooked and etc.The only problem I had with this restaurant was that it was extremely crowded so we were extremely and uncomfortably close to the 2 guys next to us.  If I were to go again, I probably would not go during its peak hours.

photos.caption: Photo of Balans Soho Society - London, United Kingdom. Yummy Liver!

wwsEGp94X7yDN0bKRNN-Kg.text: If you get a chance, start by reading their manifesto. It's rather entertaining and sets the tone for what to expect. As for whether the food lived up to their stated ethos, our group had mixed reviews. I thought it was quite good. Service was good too. So yep, 4 stars!

kh7ARRMkhhqQHGNcarq13g.text: Had dinner this evening with colleagues this evening.  Food was good, not great.  Staff friendly & attentive.  Prices fair.

MiR6XWh34IuP03-CeL9pYw.text: Delicious meal and even better service. We were seated immediately and brought water. After living in Europe for a while, I know these two things can be precious. The best thing we had was the brie appetizer, but we had nice main courses as well. Good portions but not obscene. Recommend if you are staying in the area, but no need to make a special trip.

HT7T3uccJMfueDRxKCbYwg.text: Amazing. Incredible pancakes! Great eggs Benedict as well, and the Eggs in Hell was outstanding. Wonderful service, too! Highly recommend for breakfast & brunch.

RaKIRhyfgoDAkmJ9ISVSEA.text: First time here, found through yelp. American travelers looking for fluffy pancakes and crispy bacon, this is your spot. Unfortunately we did not see the Turkish eggs on the menu, which is what a lot of reviewer recommended, but the pancakes were awesome. We did not find the menu to be overpriced at all. The interior design is very cool and hip. Would definitely go again.

Sm1ZWMNurVIJ8h34UNkL-Q.text: The Kensington branch is, in my view, one of the better outlets of this small, gay-friendly chain of cafe-restaurants. The staff are friendly and efficient, and the menu is quite wide-ranging, although a little light on vegetarian options. Brunch is good, however, and it's one of the few places a gluten-intolerant friend of mine can eat out with confidence. A better bet for lunch than dinner in my opinion. The only downside is that the tables are rather close together - great fun if you like eavesdropping, less good for a private or intimate meal...

photos.caption: Photo of Balans Soho Society - London, United Kingdom

RmVLky8UAJQNWbawCinQJQ.text: The jumbo breakfast is simply great. I ordered it with scrambled eggs and had a hard time finishing it. The portion is quite large. Eggs benedicts also looked great. The staff is very nice and helpful. If you're looking for a comfy place to have breakfast try Balans.

b17lbDD4rD6UyuB7J8rhPg.text: Outstanding service, outstanding food and really warm and inviting restaurant...great memosa's too!

LCk1d03ZMRCMIVr9Z3FWaQ.text: A great interior, very modern and stylish!Great location, too! Ideal for a break after shopping in Kensington High Street. Nice menu, an eclectic selection of dishes. The food, however, is rather mediocre.. Would recommend this place for a stylish coffee break rather than dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of Balans Soho Society - London, United Kingdom

KaoluQ9tbitn_o5UmjDw9A.text: I've always had a great time here . The food is always good the bartenders are truly mixologist and service is never a disappointment

A32MO7PbCxnrojmmAe44lA.text: Dropped in for a late night dinner (10:30pm) after seeing a show in the West End. Not many choices for late dinner near home in West Kensington. The atmosphere is super friendly and wine selection quite good. We had the Balans Burger and a Wrap. Both were really delicious and well priced. Will definitely go there again!

UPOpJLHBNmrPAapLE0FQww.text: Great food, nice ambiance.  Traffic on High Street is a little loud and annoying. I sat next to the waitstaff station, and they just stood there right in front of me, staring out the front of the shop. Hyper prompt service, but the English Breakfast, tea, blueberry cheesecake and cafe latte were all excellent.  Highly recommended for a 'gourmet'  English Breakfast experience in London, and in a excellent nice neighborhood (Kensington/Notting Hill).

bNOb1HBYWmGUfwQgomOzCA.text: Great for breakfast so far in my experience, Really good quality food and nice environment, mixing metropolis with warm local eatery well. Staff seem to turnover slot but are always attentive Slightly pricey but well worth it Free wifi always a plus

axjhs5Mat4_UXSVqyn8Q1A.text: The eggs! The potatoes! The gammon! The juices!Another branch of the Soho classic, this Balans does not disappoint. And it's on such a pretty street, too!

E0jbDQHW6a_syLadlXKwVg.text: A nice Sunday brunch option for the area. It's more urban America watering hole than most; and considering it's smack in the middle of little USA, I guess that should come as no surprise. However, it was a nice surprise to find a well-equipped bar in the center to watch the big game.The coffee was good; the service attentive; and the stack of pancakes well done. Even the egg is my benedict (comes in small and large serving--always a plus) was done to runny perfection. However, the hollandaise lacked in acidity, which is a food snobbery peeve of mine. Otherwise, an enjoyable meal. And the biggest plus of all: no queue at 11:00 on a Sunday. I think we've got a keeper!

wdJE9QPABfgSTFjYb_-MXw.text: I loved the atmosphere in the place. The tree in the middle of the room is so cool. I had the eggs royale (smoked salmon version) and it was very tasty. Nice salmon, perfectly poached egg and good texture and flavour for the hollandaise. I also had baked beans on the side, which were nice, but I don't really think they are easy to fuck up. I would have given 5 stars, if it had not been for the chives. A bit too much for my taste. The service was fine. I must point out the toilets too. They were nicely decorated.

photos.caption: Photo of Balans Soho Society - London, United Kingdom. Eggs royale - for a royal kinda morning!

lIR8iq-0px611wMsWNNURg.text: All I can say is that their red curry dish with chicken and jasmine rice is life. Ridiculously delicious, I am obsessed with it, I order it regularly. You would think it would be Indian, but it is more Thai-like than Indian with vegetables and onions, just try it and thank me later. Also, try their balans potatoes that come as a side. I would love to try other things, but I am stuck on the red curry.

fU8LgqAciDKAEVOpsh3lnA.text: My boyfriend and I were visiting London for the first time. So we didn't quite know the area. We found this restraint through Yelp and decided to try it. We were blown away by how good the food is. We tried every entree as well as a few appetizers and drinks, and they have never disappointed us. All their food is incredible. My favorite would probably be the Lemon Thyme Chicken and their Aloe drink. My boyfriend and I ended up going to this restaurant multiple times on our trip. I highly recommend it.

svdRgKwZgZKGgtqPFqI7BQ.text: While visiting London we stayed at the Best Western Kensington. On the morning walk to the tube, this had good reviews and gave us a good breakfast to start off the day. We visited on a Monday morning and honestly the place was pretty empty - only one other table for breakfast. We were greeted nicely right away and given the choice to sit anywhere we would like. The service was polite and attentive whenever we needed something. We both ordered the Soho Full English Breakfast. It came with toast (choice of white, wheat or whole grain), thick good cut bacon, sausage, potatoes, two halves of a tomato that were baked and some Portobello mushrooms that were grilled. Overall it was a good breakfast. They have a nice whole grain mustard on the table that went well with the sausage and a good ketchup (not the standard one) that was good on the potatoes. I missed the traditional beans though that go with a full English. The toast was really good and I ordered the whole grain. Overall it was filling, yummy and served fresh and hot. The only issue would be the eggs as we wanted them over easy and two of the four total served to us didn't run at all - more custardy. Not a bad place to stop in for breakfast before a day of sightseeing if in the Kensington area.

photos.caption: Photo of Balans Soho Society - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Balans Soho Society - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Balans Soho Society - London, United Kingdom

OcuOJagCoUV6BMUR9kBdYQ.text: This place is quite alright, with friendly staff and nice food. It is located really centrally in Soho and in Summer they open the windows and have some tables outside where people can sit and chat and eat. We had the Bruschetti with goat cheese and tomato and they were delicious. They also make nice drinks. For me the interior was not really my style, I went here cause my friends chose it, but that is my personal opinion and it would not be fair to rate the place soley on my taste of interior design :-) definitely a solid choice if you are in the area but if you are looking for something more special and elegant this might not be the first choice.

qFECoe63XVr8NSaeeQY4kQ.text: If you're ever in London and you do not stop here. Your visit isn't complete. Came here the first day we arrived London and it was so lovely. The staff!!!! Extremely friendly. Please see pictures. Food is delicious and worth every pound!

photos.caption: Photo of Balans Soho Society - London, United Kingdom. The Burger or life!!!! Yasssss Honey!!!
Photo of Balans Soho Society - London, United Kingdom. Roasted potatoes with some type of s a food. I don't remember which. I loved it!!!

mk_vIs2od56ZTE7iYFIDiw.text: I loved the atmosphere and the food was really good! The service was really fast too so if you're hungry it will be done quickly! I had the Full English breakfast.

photos.caption: Photo of Balans Soho Society - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Balans Soho Society - London, United Kingdom. Full English Breakfast & Eggs Benedict

g1NuAMXih8_P7L7baNpXgQ.text: We had a burger and hake fillet with squash tortellini, both were excellent. The sourdough bread was just about perfect, too. I really liked the roasted, buttered side of carrots; not at all what I was expecting and very, very good!Dessert was what really shone. We had the raspberry sorbet with orange tart and sticky toffee pudding with some sort of ice cream that complemented it. I really, really liked both and would definitely go back for lunch tomorrow if we didn't have to leave town.

n-SPTXgDxRnPfpsK6WAOVw.text: This is my favorite place I've eaten so far in London. The service is incredible (quick and personable waitstaff) and food is even better. I got the classic eggs Benedict with ham and I've never had a better hollandaise sauce! Positive atmosphere and very reasonable prices. Would love to come back if my visit here allows it.

0p_nw3Ys4w-1sxzed9TKWQ.text: The interior was very cozy but unfortunately the food didn't sit well with me.Ordered Freshly squeezed juice. Receives an off juice from a bottle which was apparently freshly squeezed. Got a replacement but still from bottle not fresh although advertised as fresh.Ordered eggs Benedict with salmon.For £9 I would expect to have more than just one piece of salmon. Tasted fine but lacked salmon and some side salad.

photos.caption: Photo of Balans Soho Society - London, United Kingdom

JyCOeFkBrdtXMiu42c9pzA.text: We had the lobster eggs Benny, burger, and absolute fluffiest pancakes ever.  Loved them all... And if you check in the condiments container on the table- have a read at their manifesto and grab some matches!

photos.caption: Photo of Balans Soho Society - London, United Kingdom. Love the matches!!
Photo of Balans Soho Society - London, United Kingdom. Pancakes with maple butter & berries
Photo of Balans Soho Society - London, United Kingdom. Buuuurgerrrr.

axStnRbEnNsGfvj7gUO-zw.text: Staff and food are very welcoming for out of towers and people from NYC! Thank you Veronica, Lenora and David for your hospitality. We will be back again and again!

photos.caption: Photo of Balans Soho Society - London, United Kingdom. Appetizers were delicious!
Photo of Balans Soho Society - London, United Kingdom. Done
Photo of Balans Soho Society - London, United Kingdom. Hi

0l0t04ke3BF802r1ZU7BuQ.text: Yes! This place has style and feeling - such a legit find in the south kes area that can be prone to vapid bars

HoTPtFMOfLC4odcTRXhfXQ.text: Went here for breakfast/brunch. One of the better eateries of London. I had the Eggs from Hell (£7) should have known it's spicy, silly me , but still was incredible. I don't normally like spicy. Coffee was whatever, decent, friend liked the pancakes. Would recommend. Oh, lovely decor. To the posh side.

ix_ZI-7qSOLHztp2VEk0tg.text: This place was so good for breakfast we stopped in for a light dinner. Both Mel's were excellent.   The service was outstanding.  And the place is clean.

photos.caption: Photo of Balans Soho Society - London, United Kingdom. Eggs Benedict
Photo of Balans Soho Society - London, United Kingdom. Morning coffee and tea
Photo of Balans Soho Society - London, United Kingdom. Traditional breakfast

k4W46NyABGepqE5L6idKiA.text: Went there for dinner. Mediocre food. Bad service. Perhaps they are better for breakfast.. But I won't risk it better cafes few blocks away

oUVAv88dRt8qnmXUVGkAyw.text: You know when you have been craving something and finally find something that fills that craving???  This is the story of that experience!  I like to think that I embrace the local foods wherever I go, however, sometimes you really just want a little taste of 'home'.  While I love the UK and think that people who say that the British food isn't very good have clearly not been to the right restaurants, as an American, there are some things that I do long for.  One of those... American pancakes.Just a couple of weekends ago, Work BFF (a fellow American) and I hit the road to try out some American pancakes and were pretty disappointed.  This past weekend we were in London for the NKOTBSB concert (I know you are jealous) and I was tasked, again, with planning our food experience.  One of Work BFF's requests was a brunch place for Monday morning.  In my Yelp! research, I found this place.  I read the reviews and we looked at the menu (increasingly, restaurants can score brownie points with me if they have a sample menu online) and decided to try it, but, as the British say, we were managing our expectations.When we arrived, it wasn't so busy we had to wait, but it seemed to have some regulars that were meeting up for their usual lunch/brunch.  We could choose wherever we wanted to sit, so we opted for the back of the restaurant as there was a skylight where the sun was coming in and we could get away from the noise of the High Street as the door opened and shut.  Our waitress was lovely, quick, and very attentive.  The menu... an indecisive person's nightmare... in a good way.  They have a breakfast portion of the menu and a lunch portion of the menu and the waitress also had some specials to tell us about.  Everything looked delicious and I was almost swayed from my mission of pancakes.  Work BFF was struggling to decide as she was set on having breakfast, but after taking a look at the menu, decided she might want lunch.When our waitress came back, we ordered, Work BFF the Cinnamon French Toast, and me the American Pancakes with bacon.  I did ask the waitress if I could have my bacon done a bit crispy she said, "No problem!"  Love it.  Our drinks (orange juice, an Americano, and two glasses of tap water... with ice) came promptly.  Honestly, we didn't wait very long before our food appeared... and not in a 'we're in a rush to get you out of here' sort of way.  I have posted a picture of our food... it looked almost like it would in the U.S.!!!!!  I say almost because usually pancakes are served with a bit of butter on top, but the pancakes were nice and large, golden, and FLUFFY... so fluffy I could die (sorry, I always think of that movie when I hear or say fluffy).  And the bacon... it was three pieces of crispy, streaky bacon!!!!  My level of excitement may have been equal to that of seeing the Backstreet Boys in concert the night before, hearing they were recording another album, and my favourite, Kevin, was coming back to the group... just sayin'.I poured the syrup on and went for a taste... HEAVENLY!  This is what I have been searching for!  I can stop searching for places to have pancakes!  They were delicious and I thought there was just the right amount on the plate.  They do skimp a bit on the syrup, especially with the size of the pancakes, but if you ask they will give you more, as Work BFF found out when she asked for more for her Cinnamon French Toast (which looked awesome with the strawberries and bananas on the side... she reported it tasted good as well).  We also discovered that the syrup was real Vermont Maple Syrup (Work BFF was able to identify the bottle from across the room), not that Tasty Treat Maple Flavoured Ice Cream Topping.Our waitress stopped to check on us a few times, which was nice that we didn't have to wave her down for anything.  And... for the enormous pancakes and bacon, it is £6.25.  I believe I reviewed another restaurant for their three tiny pancakes and their cost is more than that!  And my Americano was £2.40... under £10!  Work BFF's French Toast was £6.25 as well, and her orange juice was more than £2.40, but she also had a massive glass of it.  This was a good bargain in our opinion (and we get paid in USD...)!  The search for the American pancake is over!

photos.caption: Photo of Balans Soho Society - London, United Kingdom. Cinnamon French Toast with Strawberries and Bananas at the top and American Pancakes with bacon at the bottom.  Amazing.

h1r3RM-cKYbToRHhN0bpHA.text: A decent fty up as fry ups go. Not great, not bad just A-ok.This place is in a great location, the decor is looking a little hmmm. Serivice is quite poor if friendly.Wont rush back but wouldnt avoid either.

kZFZqgcMoL7HMtsxLV7nlA.text: We came here for brunch with 2 friends couple and we were very delighted by our choice. They do take reservation for the Sunday brunch which is a very plus side. We ordered a few cocktails and the traditional Bloody Mary which was ok. Then as food the highlight came with their High Society Eggs Benedict. They were wonderful, nicely cooked and with the lobster that add a lot of taste to it. All in all a very nice brunch, service was very nice and the setting is quite nice as well. We will come back!

xr7LC8OY_wOl0u3z3DpZeA.text: I came here for breakfast and despite a plethora of options, I went with the Jumbo since this was my first time here.  Everything about Balans was solid to very good.  The service was very good, the environment was clean and chic and the food was above average.  However, it was not great, thus the four stars.

qNvRKQL2tUHYRP4WBy9pog.text: Visited for my first time and will be a frequent visitor in my future travels! Place: Very clean, and very stylish. Options for outside sitting (very limited) as well as many options for seats inside.Service: the servers were very kind, and funny. Unfortunately, I don't think there was enough of them for the Sunday morning brunch crowd. Service was awfully slow and they were running around like crazy. If I wasn't alone, it would have been better since I would have had someone to converse with. Although limited, my interactions with servers were positive and they seemed caring.Menu: menu is fantastic with many great options that had my mouth watering. Wasn't sure which to choose. Based off Yelp recommendations, I chose The High Society Eggs Benedict. Delicious! Went perfect with English Breakfast tea.Credit Card/Contactless is accepted.*HIGHLY RECOMMENDED*

photos.caption: Photo of Balans Soho Society - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Balans Soho Society - London, United Kingdom

8wZkcmqpSlSmfT2deFoKrw.text: This was so good. The food was so delicious that you don't need salt & pepper. The eggs are cooked to perfection. The restaurant is adorable & the staff is delightful. I love the tree table in the back. We enjoyed the "Full English Breakfast" with coffee.

photos.caption: Photo of Balans Soho Society - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Balans Soho Society - London, United Kingdom

zgKuRzFiAuq7_pVf9D6q9Q.text: I absolutely fell in love with this place! It intrigued me when I found it here on yelp and it's conveniently 5 minutes away from where I stay in London. I love that they are all about indulging yourself so I know I can go there and not be judged for indulging myself on everything from their appetizers to their delectable desserts!  At first I ordered some Chenin Blanc and their Crisp Polenta. Their menu is divided up well so you can get a little or a lot and they even deliver some late night food too which I plan to check out next time! The polenta was fried in squares and on a bed of kale that was perfectly dressed in a red pepper dressing. While I was reading my book and savoring every last bite, two of my fellow flight attendants walked in and the staff was so nice about us joining tables and made sure we were comfortable and had plenty of space.  Since I was staying a bit longer I couldn't resist ordering the Pina Colada cheesecake. It was so smooth and fresh and to make it even better it has coconut sorbet on top, which in my opinion is WAY better than slopping some whipped cream on a dessert and calling it a day. I can't wait to have another layover in London so I can try out their red curry, salmon, and roasted cauliflower. They truly have something for everyone, and plenty of vegetarian options which I greatly appreciate! You should know in advance that they have a rewards card but they'll only give it to one person per table. Even more reason for me to venture out by myself, gotta earn that free cocktail.

photos.caption: Photo of Balans Soho Society - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Balans Soho Society - London, United Kingdom

aYqpqxAoC2R9T9NxHzRsBQ.text: The smoothie was delicious. It had a good balance between the strawberries and bananas. Which the portion was more though for the price that was paid. The club sandwich was a lot. My boyfriend ordered it and told the server we were going to share and went ahead and split the platter for us both. So, what you see in the photo is half of the dish. The sandwich was all right. Nothing disappointing or amazing. Just your regular sandwich.

photos.caption: Photo of Balans Soho Society - London, United Kingdom. Strawberry banana smoothie
Photo of Balans Soho Society - London, United Kingdom. Club sandwich

OdbjOko3MTrPlDsuO6FCBg.text: Touched down on our 2 week European vacation dropped our bags to the hotel and were starving. Boom! Our first stop in London was at Balans in Kensington. We walked in right as they opened and the staff greeted us in a very courtesy manner. We sat down and ordered some breakfast, asked for mimosas or any alcohol but unfortunately they didn't service alcohol this early (only reason I'm giving it 4 stars.) I ordered the poached eggs with steak and some Home fries. The food was amazing very filling staff was amazing. They have multiple locations of this place so make sure you check it out. I highly recommend it.

photos.caption: Photo of Balans Soho Society - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Balans Soho Society - London, United Kingdom

iBAHiCJDLbIyzUOHxkWqjQ.text: Well I had a not bad omelette but I have had better. Not very tasty.  The very berry smoothie was awesome!  The granola was very good but be prepared the Yogurt was a very heavy think Greek style one, so be ready.  The big breakfast was good, and very big :)  night e ambiance, service was just ok.  Not a bad spot but I kept looking..

photos.caption: Photo of Balans Soho Society - London, United Kingdom. Omelette was ok,  but not really tasty. Not enough cheese etc.
Photo of Balans Soho Society - London, United Kingdom. Good sized big breakfast... Tasty too
Photo of Balans Soho Society - London, United Kingdom. Very tasty but heavy Yogurt...

8hPrL3VBPVC3bwWPghebCg.text: I am usually in London a couple of times a month for work and this place is right by our hotel so I used to go often. The drinks themselves are very well done but the bartenders lack personality and are not at all engaging. Usually at a bar you bs with the bartenders and hold some kind of conversation. On a side note, I was visiting with a coworker once and the manager came over and told me we needed to "calm down"... I was like is this a bar or a church??!! Lol.. I figured I could have fun after spending 10 pounds (13 dollars) on each cocktail and I was just talking and laughing with a friend! I ordered an old fashioned and they tacked on 2 more pounds because it was an old fashioned!! Wtf. Whatever, the drinks are well done, but for the price and zero atmosphere I'll go somewhere else.

n33u2kbNJnfh_dvhETXU0w.text: Came here for breakfast on a Sunday after church.  Conveniently located on the high street and has a solid breakfast menu with British / American cuisine.  I had the eggs and bacon which were good and also came with a very large piece of toast.  Service was good and if you're looking for a casual breakfast spot this is a good pick.

photos.caption: Photo of Balans Soho Society - London, United Kingdom. Breakfast menu

6Ph5zdJHRrJjRZSzLK-4aQ.text: This is an outstanding restaurant. The service is top notch and the food is superb. Our waiter Luiz ensured that everything was perfect. My only complaint is the bartender. She tends to short the shot glass with drinks. We watched and saw her only fill the shot glass only halfway when making drinks.

photos.caption: Photo of Balans Soho Society - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Balans Soho Society - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Balans Soho Society - London, United Kingdom

QVeiSoVIae_nFvIKvdnlww.text: Six of us came to Balans for dinner and drinks the other night. It was right around dinnertime and fortunately had no trouble finding seats. The ambiance was funky, had that dim lit hipster vibe. The walls had unique trinkets and beautiful candle pieces were lit throughout the restaurant. The service was a bit slow, taking quite some time that we asked if they had forgotten about us. We ordered just a single round of drinks, some bread and chips for the table, and then entrees. The chips didn't come out til half of us received our food, and there was quite an awkward delay for the last couple people to be given food that the first orders out had become cold. Cocktails are a bit steep, £11 for a tiny, mostly ice glass. I ordered a slap on the rum; mixed rum cocktail with pineapple juice and mint leaves. The mint was constantly getting stuck in my mouth as I sipped it and that was kind of inconvenient. For food, this is where they deserve high stars. The crab pasta was incredible. A very expensive £17, but it was to die for. Would we all go back? Probably not. But it was a fun night with great people.

photos.caption: Photo of Balans Soho Society - London, United Kingdom. Crab pasta was delicious
Photo of Balans Soho Society - London, United Kingdom. slam on the rum cocktail
Photo of Balans Soho Society - London, United Kingdom. menu

mxbmf_nXPlL3bNu1U47iHA.text: Breccie is the most important meal of the day..I agree ..that is why I chose here.Ducking under the blue velvet curtain, we were immediately seated by a lovely waitress. The decor was fab and quirky. Unusual art lined the walls, a large melted  stalactite like candle dominated the counter, and at the far back a large white painted tree.The menu synced with the decor. I.e creative. From kedgeree to fluffy pancakes, salmon and steak.So at 10am a lobster, avocado, salmon and bacon poached eggs was ordered..and a hair of the dog cocktail to wash it down..oh and a flat white. My friend ordered the crispy bacon, poached eggs on sour dough with the pineapple swizzle.Little things like the freshly made condiments served in archaic bottles gave it that extra special touch.When the food arrived , it tasted good as it looked. For £13 mine was worth every penny..the morning after cocktails made with lemon and absinth also hit the mark..and the flat white was perfect.The service was faultless throughout and overall I really enjoyed my experience here.  You must come here for breccie!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Balans Soho Society - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Balans Soho Society - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Balans Soho Society - London, United Kingdom. Absinth and lemon juice cocktail

TeEJAjMNLDa6NnXe4rarWA.text: The Soho english breakfast was super delicious. It consists of a sausage, 2 fried ham slices, 2 eggs, potatoes, a portobello mushroom and fried tomatoes. A great combination - proteins, carbs and salt :) All you need for a good start in the day.Together with a deep flavored but not overwhelming coffee americano, it was a perfect start into a sunny Sunday ! P.s. the self baked bread is amazing

photos.caption: Photo of Balans Soho Society - London, United Kingdom

Yo7mcsdbXocnxy4YTGEapA.text: Balans is a great place to meetup with friends for drinks and/or dinner. It's hip vibe creates a very cozy atmosphere and the drink/cocktail menu is extensive. If you're a member of their club, then cocktails are buy 1 get one 1 free during happy hours. We all had the Negroni, which was the perfect balance of alcohol with a touch of sweet, garnished with a fresh, juicy orange slice. The interior space towards the front of the restaurant isn't huge, so be careful of the one table next to the stairs that go down to the toilets as you can faintly smell the toilets from a couple of those seats!Service was great - prompt and very friendly. It took a few tries to get the right number of drinks at our table for some reason, but they got there eventually with a few reminders. Prices are reasonable and pretty much what you'd expect for the delicious quality of cocktails that they serve!! Though we didn't order food, all of the plates that passed me on their way to other tables smelled wonderful!

c-HwMBnxlG5_oF-wY6c7Eg.text: Visited Balans since they still had breakfast on the menu late in the day on Sunday. We were pleasantly surprised with their unique and chic atmosphere, friendly service and lovely food! Hopefully planning another visit before we leave town so I can try the eggs benedict! Perfect brunch spot!

photos.caption: Photo of Balans Soho Society - London, United Kingdom. French toast
Photo of Balans Soho Society - London, United Kingdom. Excellent espresso
Photo of Balans Soho Society - London, United Kingdom. Signature flatware

rKYVt1wHRJDBAVqRzP6O5g.text: Chose this place almost at random and was surprised at how good the food was. The Togarashi & Peanut Tofu was really tasty, done well. My companions were very pleased with the Papardelle and the Red Curry. Our waiter was good and personable. The venue was really loud with people, but the decor was pleasant.

photos.caption: Photo of Balans Soho Society - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Balans Soho Society - London, United Kingdom. Togarashi & Peanut Tofu was very tasty

vjksYcHCZ6ASU3urQBPc-w.text: I enjoyed my visit to Balans Soho Society. Admittedly, I thought it was part of the a different Balans restaurant that I've eaten at in London and Miami previously, but the experience was still enjoyable.Staff was very kind and waitress was particularly attentive. Food was also great. Came on a Monday night and wasn't terribly busy, which is always a plus.

36DyjJ8mz3XUOF0HdTynig.text: Happened to run into this place on a cold London Sunday morning. Glad I did. Excellent service, food, ambiance and coffee. Thank you!

53s7aPVib0s3aYkzJULb5w.text: One of my favorite breakfast spots in London. I've also eaten lunch here and that did not disappoint either. Everything I've eaten is fantastic. The eggs in the eggs benedict are always cooked to perfection which can be hard to find these days. Solid bloody mary too, and they made me an Irish coffee when I asked, though it was clear they don't get that request often.

QVpUFwhKT1qgtyUWyoTXmA.text: Okay. Before I commence this review, I have to set the scene, which may give bias to why I'm giving this place a freaking 5-star-er. Firstly. It was my birthday. This is enough to make me give anything 5 stars. Secondly, I had just moved to London, so I was feeling pretty on top of the world (you know, before the whole "why are there SO MANY PEOPLE and WHY ARE THEY ALL NEAR ME" thing set in. Thirdly, I had two glasses of Champagne, making it pretty hard for me not to be exceptionally happy at this stage.  I ordered a burger. But this wasn't just any ol' burger. It was THE burger. The Infamous Balans Burger (cue Western music). Swiss cheese. Bacon. (Crispy Bacon!). Tomato. Dill Pickle. Red Onion. Surrounded in the arms of a brioche bun. Cusped by the sweaty palms of triple.cooked.chips. And to top it all off, a big hunky knife stabbed right down the middle. All companied with a quaint wooden box full of homemade looking jars of sauce and stuff. The staff were friendly, efficient and the atmosphere warm and happening. We sat outside beneath the heater (best of both worlds) and were happy. Oh so happy.

photos.caption: Photo of Balans Soho Society - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Balans Soho Society - London, United Kingdom. So sexy.

Y2s2xFPTKGiuQd4osmfcUg.text: Balans understands how to kick start your day! Attention is paid from choice of farm eggs (from Kent!) to specially selected bread and butter. And the bits of avocado, potato cubes and chunky lobster pieces are heavenly! There's pride and passion about serving you superior quality brekkie! #lovethattoast Enjoy!

photos.caption: Photo of Balans Soho Society - London, United Kingdom. Simple, classic and yet nourishing variety of breakfast style foods!
